result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Miguel A Morales Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst in court for Miguel A Morales Rodriguez. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. 
Matter set to address State's De Novo review from early this same day. 
State renews their request for $10,000 cash bond and gives further statement as to why. 
Defense gives statement as to why $10,000 is inappropriate.
BTC: Bond will remain as set as defendant is on a hold.
State's Motion for Denovo Review of Bond

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.
